{"pagelen": 10, "values": [{"description": "- made all strings unicode per default (no more `u''`)
- removed custom enum class, using `enum.Enum` (or `enum34` from py27)
- removed all `super(self.__class__)` references
- loosen `requirements-dev.txt` (latest httpretty works with py35 ☺)
- use of new style `open()` in test fixtures

I believe this is likely to break support for py26. But who cares about py26 anymore? 😀", "links": {"decline": {"href": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/python-bitbucket/pullrequests/6/decline"}, "commits": {"href": "https://bitbucket.org/account/Mekk/avatar/32/"}}}, "created_on": "2015-12-01T16:23:06.605945+00:00", "reason": "", "updated_on": "2015-12-01T16:55:06.104427+00:00", "type": "pullrequest", "id": 2, "task_count": 0}, {"description": "Wrong parsing of username
---------------------------

Username returned from repository_create is plain text, not structure.
So the code crashed with:

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/home/marcink/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pybitbucket/repository.py", line 139, in create_repository
        return Repository(response.json(), client=client)
      File "/home/marcink/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pybitbucket/repository.py", line 57, in __init__
        self.owner = User(data['owner'], client=client)
      File "/home/marcink/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pybitbucket/bitbucket.py", line 111, in __init__
        in data.items()}
    AttributeError: 'unicode' object has no attribute 'items'

I fixed that by detecting that case and making tiny user-like structure
out of it.

Bad handling of missing links
--------------------------------

Once I started returning this structure, I got:

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/home/marcink/DEV_hg/python/bitbucket/pybitbucket/repository.py", line 146, in create_repository
        return Repository(response.json(), client=client)
      File "/home/marcink/DEV_hg/python/bitbucket/pybitbucket/repository.py", line 65, in __init__
        if data.get('links').get('clone'):
    AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get'

As using .get showed intent to keep working in case block is missing, I fixed
it appropriately, so the line above yielded None instead of crashing.", "links": {"decline": {"href": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/python-bitbucket/pullrequests/1/decline"}, "commits": {"href": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/python-bitbucket/pullrequests/1/commits"}, "self": {"href": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/python-bitbucket/pullrequests/1"}, "comments": {"href": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/python-bitbucket/pullrequests/1/comments"}, "merge": {"href": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/python-bitbucket/pullrequests/1/merge"}, "html": {"href": "https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/python-bitbucket/pull-requests/1"}, "activity": {"href": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/python-bitbucket/pullrequests/1/activity"}, "diff": {"href": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/python-bitbucket/pullrequests/1/diff"}, "approve": {"href": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/python-bitbucket/pullrequests/1/approve"}, "statuses": {"href": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/python-bitbucket/pullrequests/1/statuses"}}, "title": "Bugfixes for two crashes appearing during reply parsing of repository_create (output of this command is different from normal status, unfortunately). The latter appeared after I fixed the former.", "close_source_branch": true, "merge_commit": {"hash": "ae3d212a5fab", "links": {"self": {"href":
